question: All right. The Gold Card. Don't leave home without it.
answer: Let's beat it, man. I don't like being up here.

question: What, scared of heights?
answer: I dunno, man. After what happened to Johnny Gobs --

question: Look, Johnny Gobs got ripped and walked off a roof, all right? No big loss.
answer: That ain't what I heard. That ain't what I heard at all. I heard the bat got him.

question: Gimme a break, will you? Shut up...
answer: Five stories, straight down. There was no blood in the body.

question: No shit. It was all over the pavement.
answer: There was no blood, man. My brother says... all the bad things you done... they come back and haunt you...

question: Listen to this. How old are you? There ain't no bat.
answer: My brother's a priest, man.

question: No wonder you're such a chickenshit. Now shut up. There ain't no bat.
answer: You shouldn'ta turned the gun on that kid, man. You shouldn'ta --

question: Anything new?
answer: The usual gas. If this clown could lay a hand on Grissom... I would've had to kill him by now.

question: If Grissom knew about us... he might kill you.
answer: Don't think so, angel. I'm too valuable. That's the way I've planned it. And besides, he doesn't know.

question: You look just fine, Jack.
answer: ... I didn't ask.

question: Variety, huh? The spice of life.
answer: Great, but tell me Good answer. I'm gonna put you in for a commendation.

question: Oh Christ, it's Knox.
answer: Hiya, gents. This anything I should know about?

question: You didn't show up.
answer: We had another bat sighting.

question: I'm sure that was vitally important. Listen
answer: I'm doing the best I can. If it's a problem --

question: Eckhardt... our problems are your problems.
answer: I'll work on it.

question: Very nice, Lieutenant. But a little ostentatious on a cop's salary, don't you think?
answer: I answer to Grissom, punk. Not to you.

question: You're a smart boy, Eckhardt. You should be thinking about the future.
answer: Ambition. Forget it, Jack. You'll never run that organization.

question: And why's that?
answer: You're a psycho, friend. You're an A-one crazy boy and Grissom knows it.

question: What have you got for me, Jerry? I'm real busy, Clark. Be a pal and dust him, okay? ... Vicki Vale.
answer: How'd you know it was me?

question: Honey -- I would know any randomly selected square inch of Vicki Vale. If I had a good enough hint.
answer: A nice, restful vacation.

question: God, a girl could get hurt doing this.
answer: I do get hurt.

question: Got any more of those?
answer: Nothing I'm at liberty to reveal here. What's new and hot in Gotham City?

question: It's too good, Vick. We got a six- foot bat that swoops out of the night and preys on evildoers.
answer: Evildoers, huh? Big or small?

question: Small so far. I mean -- they don't allow bats in boardrooms, do they.
answer: Speaking of which... I hear the notorious Bruce Wayne is throwing a big do for the Harvey Dent campaign.

question: Yeah. Hottest ticket in town. Every law'n'order freak in the city's gonna be there.
answer: No.

question: Well, I'm starving. Will you at least buy me a hamburger?
answer: Yes, but please -- be gentle.

question: Nine points ahead in the new poll. I don't like the way this is shaping up.
answer: We can always pop him. -- Or pop someone close to him.

question: He's going after our front companies. Specifically Ace Chemical. Which would tie us in with Councilman Kane, Senator Miller... on up the line. We have to clean out our files before the subpoena comes down. I'm thinking break-in. Trash the office, remove the relevant documents...
answer: "Industrial espionage."

question: That's right. And Jack -- I'd like you to handle this operation personally.
Hello, sweetheart. I wonder if you'd mind waiting in the other room.
answer: Why do you need me to handle a simple break-in?

question: Because I want someone I can trust.
answer: I understand.

question: How high up would you say that is?
answer: I'd say about thirty feet, sir.

question: You know, if you cut your bathroom in half, you'd have my apartment.
answer: Which bathroom is that, air?

question: Aww, Commissioner. There's gotta be one honest cop in Gotham city.
answer: How's your luck, Jim?

question: Mr. Dent. What's your stand on winged vigilantes?
answer: Mr. Knox, I think we have enough real problems in this city without worrying about ghosts and goblins and Halloween characters.

question: My question is, where does one man get all this junk.
answer: All over the world. They say he spends most of the year overseas -- until recently, anyway.

question: Holy shit...
answer: Just what I've heard. Rich. Reclusive. Old money and lots of it.

question: Likes to kill?
answer: Women find him magnetic.

question: I bet they like him for his big charity balls.
answer: That, and the sweet smell of two hundred million bucks.

question: Well, you know me. The more they've got, the less they're worth. This guy must be the most worthless man in America. I assume in my usual charming manner I've just insulted the host. Alexander Knox.
answer: Bruce Wayne. -- I've read your work. I quite like it.

question: Great. Give me a grant.
answer: I might consider it if you introduce me to Miss Vale.

question: "This is Miss Vale." -- That felt redundant.
answer: You're just back from Corto Maltese. I saw your combat photos. Quite a departure for you.

question: I know the rich are different, but that guy is real different.
answer: Oh. Sorry. I was thinking.

question: What were you thinking?
answer: Yum, yum.

question: Well, he must like the way he looks. He's got a mirror in every room.
answer: I get it. Bruce Vain.

question: NO!!
answer: LOOK!

question: HOLD YOUR FIRE!
answer: ... Who is this guy?

question: Commissioner. Do us both a favor. Don't tell me some lie you'll have to retract later.
answer: Guess who's got a date with Bruce Wayne.

question: Bruce Wayne? Date? He called you up and asked you for a date?... Shit. HEY MIRANDA! C'MERE! I want you to pay close attention to this. Miranda -- tell my friend here what you told me about Bruce Wayne. Yeah. "Mister One-Nighter." Because that's the average length of his relationships with women. Tell her about the peanuts.
answer: Peanuts?

question: Yeah. Peanuts. Which is how he goes through women.
answer: Plain or roasted? Alex, I'm very flattered that you've gone out and done all this research.

question: Why? Aw, come on, Vicki, I'm a reporter. I'm curious. I do this for a living. -- What'd you tell him?
answer: I told him yes.

question: ... What was that? Miranda, I'm busy. Go be productive.
answer: Do you sail?

question: Do you sail?
answer: Too much work. I'm not really the physical type. -- Thank you, Alfred.

question: You do a very convincing imitation. Mm, this is tasty. What's yours?
answer: Two drinks and I start swinging from the rooftops. Tell me, Vicki. There's something I'm very curious about. What took you down to Corto Maltese?

question: ... I guess I needed a change.
answer: You were one of the most successful magazine photographers in the city. Everyone wanted you.

question: Have you ever been to Corto Maltese?
answer: Not since the shooting started.

question: We went there once when I was little. I played on the beach. And at nights -- they had a band -- I danced with my father on the hotel patio. That was Corto Maltese. When the war broke out I had to go back. And I promised myself that this time... I wouldn't look away.
answer: What did you see?

question: ... Terror.
answer: There's terror everywhere. Some types are just more -- familiar than others.

question: I'm sorry. I didn't mean to -- I know it all seems a million miles away, out here on the water, with all this --
answer: Insulation?

question: Bruce, really, when I say these things I don't mean to criticize you.
answer: I think you see things very clearly.

question: I'm happy to talk about something else. I don't want to be depressing.
answer: Do you assume that if I know you better I won't like you as much?

question: I'm sorry, Bruce, I have to ask. Are you like this with the other women you know? -- Because I just can't seem to get a handle on this conversation.
answer: Vicki, if I say anything cryptic, or... ambiguous, I think you should put the most flattering possible interpretation on it. Because even if it doesn't sound that way... that's how I'll mean it.

question: -- but it's not fair. I'm half drunk and you're not even --
answer: Would you like me to take you home?

question: God. You would. Come on, Bruce. I just want to get two drinks in you. As an experiment.
answer: Maybe we should just kiss.

question: Mirror. Mirror.
answer: That you, sugar bumps?

question: It's me. "Sugar Bumps."
answer: Jack? Thank God. I can't believe it's you. I heard you'd been --

question: Is that what you "heard"?
answer: Sooner or later you would've tried to take me, Jack. You may get me now, but your life won't be worth a dime.

question: I've died once already. It wasn't so bad. -- In fact I recommend it.
answer: Jack, listen -- we'll cut a deal --

question: JACK? JACK? DO I LOOK LIKE A JACK??
answer: Jack -- I'm warning you. WIPE THAT

question: ... To tell you the truth, I'd just about given up waiting.
answer: I said I'd call you the minute I got free. And I did. -- And here we are.

question: Hm hmm. Lunch. Not even dinner.
answer: Vicki. Do you want the whole truth? All coyness aside? I wish I had more time to give you. Every day I don't see you, I miss you. Now. Are you going to waste this lovely afternoon being all mad at me?

question: Okay, I'm a sucker. You sound so much like someone I used to... Bruce? I know this is silly, but -- you're not married, are you? All street mimes should be executed.
answer: ... Looks like a convention.

question: Please tell him... I'm not trying to make his life difficult. I'd just -- I'd just like to know what's going on.
answer: Hiya, peanut. I got something I'd like you to see. Okay, here we go. Check it out.

question: Oh my God... I've seen this picture.
answer: I guess so. Pulitzer Prize, 1963.

question: His face. Allie, look at his face.
answer: Yep. He watched the whole thing happen. -- Recognize the beat cop? Jim Gordon.

question: Oh, Bruce...
answer: Something like this -- what do you suppose this could drive a guy to?

question: Alexander, you are on drugs.
answer: He walks out on his own party. Half an hour later, the Caped Crusader turns up in full bat-drag. Sees an execution, freaks out in an alleyway. No place to change. Yeah, Vicki, he's "married" all right.

question: You're pissing me off, Allie. I know exactly why you're doing this.
answer: Oh? Why is that, Vicki?

question: He's best friends with Jim Gordon and Harvey Dent. They would know.
answer: ... Okay, Vicki, I have a confession to make. I'm the Batman.

question: Alexander... I know you.
answer: Right. And they know him. And that's why it would never occur to them for a minute that their old buddy Bruce puts on a cape at night and goes out looking for --

question: This is pointless. I'm leaving.
answer: Your little chum is out of his mind. Next time you call him up and he can't go out Friday night -- think it over.

question: Get dressed. We're going out.
answer: I'm meeting Mr. Wayne. Is he here?

question: Okay, boys, let's broaden our minds. I think it's safe to take that off.
answer: ... Thank you.

question: Unfortunate, but I think we can work around it.
answer: And you want a --

question: A visual record, yes. A before-and- after kind of thing. This could make your reputation.
answer: Maybe we should start with a portrait of the artist. People might like to see the face behind the makeup.

question: ... Behind the makeup?
answer: I've seen worse. Much worse.

question: Shucks, honey, I forgot. (rolling his eyes at
answer: ... Why the mask?

question: Alicia! Come here, have a seat. Show Miss Vale why you wear the mask.
answer: You SCUM! You SICK FILTH!... You DID THAT to her!

question: What? I improved her a little...
answer: I'll see you burn. I'll see you dead. -- GET AWAY FROM ME!!

question: Miss Vale, was it something I said? Do you want to sniff my flower?
answer: NO!

question: ... Not even a 'thank you'?
answer: Well -- I think you might consider thanking me. You were good as dead.

question: That's because you lied about your weight. Thank you.
answer: I just wanted to distract them. I wasn't trying to get a picture of you.

question: Please.
answer: I won't let you have it.

question: The Joker is a murderer. And you were as good as dead. So --
answer: Look, I appreciate what you did for me. But this is my job. And I'm keeping those pictures.

question: All right, here's a compromise. I'll develop the photos. You keep the Jokers and I'll keep the rest.
answer: How do I know you won't keep them all?

question: Because I'll take you with me.
answer: ... Where are you going to take me?

question: STOP!
answer: ... How long have I been out?

question: Quite a while. I took the scenic route.
answer: Well, I've certainly enjoyed it. What's that?

question: Garage door.
answer: I meant to ask you. Up on the roof -- how did you know my name? What is this stuff? Kevlar?

question: Better. It's not on the market yet.
answer: It doesn't protect your head, though.

question: That's why I wear a target on my chest.
answer: How'd you find this place?

question: Stumbled across it when I was a boy.
answer: I don't like bats. Not that kind.

question: They used to terrify me. But I forced myself to keep coming back, and -- -- I guess I became the thing I feared the most. I'll do your photos now.
answer: Who pays for all this?

question: I have sponsors.
answer: The computers?

question: I'm running a check on the tainted products. There is a pattern. Beauty products. Personal hygiene.
answer: No more makeup. -- Looks like we'll all be showing our true faces now.

question: I've tracked all the records. Every shipment, every warehouse, every loading dock. Nothing. No opportunities for tampering. Somehow the Joker is supplying tainted ingredients... at the source.
answer: Wait. You can just tap into any corporate database you want? Anywhere?

question: Oh, no. I let the FBI do that. Then I tap into the FBI. -- Your photos are ready.
answer: You could've killed him, you know. You could have killed the Joker.

question: I had to save you, Vicki. Here you go. I think I'll let you keep the whole set.
answer: ... Bruce?

question: Vicki... ? Vicki, I've been thinking about you. I know it's late. I'm sorry. I -- Are you there?
answer: Yes, Bruce -- I'm here --

question: I'm sorry about the way things went between us. I'd very much like to see you again.
answer: Well, Bruce... I don't think... that would be possible.

question: I wish you'd reconsider. I didn't stand you up today. The museum was closed when I got there.
answer: I, uh...

question: Vicki, it all fits. The stuff you're telling me -- the car, the equipment -- somebody's paying for it.
answer: I just can't --

question: The FBI. You know who's got the FBI computer contract? Wayne Technologies. The guy's bats all right. He's bat shit crazy. This is gonna be the most incredible --
answer: But he's not.

question: Not what?
answer: He's not crazy.

question: Vicki. We got a wealthy millionaire here... who dresses up like a bat. He goes out at night and swings around -- in his cape -- on a rope. Okay. Maybe I'm crazy.
answer: Allie... he wants to tell me. That's why he took me there. Because he's trying to tell me.

question: Gimme a break. If he wants to chat, he can talk to his car.
answer: He has to tell someone. And I'm the one. He's trying to tell me.

question: Actually, I wanted to talk to Batman. Pass that on to Mr. Wayne, would you?
answer: I've been expecting to hear from you.

question: Well, that's how it is, chum. She tells me everything.
answer: What is it you want?

question: Simple. You know the score. One column -- and I can bring all this tumbling down. I can take you off the streets once and for all. I want you to hang up the suit. And I want you to stay away from Vicki.
answer: I can't do that. Not while the Joker's still out there.

question: Then stay away from Vicki. That's all I want, man. I just want your word.
answer: There's something I don't understand. If you've got the story, why haven't you printed it?

question: Because I -- Because she'd never speak to me again.
answer: Do you want a drink?

question: Yeah, a drink. "Civilized." Man-to- man, right?
answer: Alfred, bring something for Mr. Knox. -- I'll have one too.

question: Alfred, bring something for Mr. Knox. -- I'll have one too.
answer: ... So we just pretend none of this ever happened. We never met. We -- You're going to get yourself killed, Bruce. You know that, don't you?

question: It wouldn't matter much.
answer: I don't understand it. You can do so much good for people. As Bruce Wayne.

question: Money makes money, Vicki. The foundation runs itself. -- I'm extraneous to the process.
answer: You're one man. You can't save everybody.

question: What it I could save a handful? -- What if I could save one?
answer: Bruce, at the rate you're going, you can't even save yourself.

question: Sometimes... I don't know if there's enough of me left to save.
answer: Oh, God. I've got to have some coffee or something.

question: Are you expecting anyone? Set it down by the door. On the left-hand side.
answer: BRUCE!

question: Very thoughtful. Don't touch it.
answer: Oh, Bruce. Don't tell me you carry it around with you.

question: I feel naked without it. ... They're wax.
answer: "It worked for Van Gogh. Let's make up. I'll need you soon." -- Whew.

question: Keep her on the line!
answer: ... Where are you calling from? I'm sorry, she hung up. What are --

question: Finding out where she is.
answer: How can you do that if she's already off the line?

question: I've had an automatic tracer on this number ever since he tracked you to the museum. Got it!
answer: What now!

question: Like your boyfriend. He's kinda hot. Hands off the belt.
answer: Take me. Let the boy go.

question: Gosh, I could kill you, but then you'd miss my party. And I'd be real, real sad if you couldn't make it.
answer: What are you talking about?

question: My name is Bruce Wayne. You're welcome to stay here as long as you want.
answer: We'll send a team into Ace the moment the warrant comes through.

question: He'll be ready when you do. Remember what happened at the apartment.
answer: All right, Bruce, what do you suggest?

question: I suggest a nice big bomb.
answer: Good. A bomb. On a blind tip from Bruce Wayne. -- We do have laws.

question: Then for God's sake, Harvey, cancel the anniversary celebration.
answer: We've told him we'll deal. What could he possibly have to gain by --

question: Do you still think the Joker cares about money??
answer: I don't know. I'm just a D.A. I don't have access to all your expert sources.

question: ... Your butler wouldn't gimme a ride so I figured I'd hoof it.
answer: Sorry. I can't let you leave.

question: You can't keep me here, man. That's kidnapping.
answer: If I let you leave, you'll do the same thing again. You'll go after the Joker... and you'll wind up dead.

question: Hey, man. Look at you. You're rich. You got everything you want. How do you know what's in my mind?
answer: I don't care what's in your mind. You're staying.

question: In all these years... why couldn't I see how it would turn out? Where's the boy?
answer: Upstairs. He's quite docile.

question: I know that feeling. It won't last.
answer: Yes, sir.

question: VICKI!
answer: Yeah. Deja vu.

question: What do you say? Let's head for the lights. So much for Underdog.
answer: ALLIE!! THE WINDOWS!!

question: WHAT HAPPENED?!?
answer: Oh my God. Compressor tanks. He's got the balloons rigged with compressor tanks!!

question: Jesus Christ, the guy's a genius.
answer: LOOK! IT'S BRUCE!! Allie -- the balloons. We've got to find some way to tell him!

question: GET THE CAR! HOLY SHIT!!
answer: You okay?

question: Yeah. Yeah. Little winded. DID YOU SEE THAT?!
answer: God yes, Allie. I've gotta say -- that was the ballsiest move I ever --

question: Holy shit. Holy --
answer: ALLIE!!

question: HEY! COME ON! Now we're even, huh? Even up.
answer: How did you...

question: I hitched. MOVE IT!
answer: The Joker. Is he --?

question: Forget it. Relax. ... He's mine now.
answer: DICK!

question: DICK!
answer: Gotham cathedral. Come and get me. I'm in the belltower. Don't land. ... Batman?

question: Mad... man...
answer: Well now, you're not exactly the picture of mental health, are you.

question: ... Murderer...
answer: Bruce, we're both murderers. Think how many people you've killed by letting me live.
